column1: Hi Everyone,I have my yearly trip to the Capri in late July and I am wondering if you guys think it will be possible o go. I'm also going to Positano and Ischia. It's already payed and I dont want the money back just to travel.

How would anyone here know? It is far too early to know what will even be happening by next week (in Italy or anywhere)- let alone months from now.I'd wait to cancel because if flights are canceled, you should get a refund - as to non-refundable accommodations, that's up to the individual properties.
Obviously here, in Italy we have a magic crustal ball to answer such showering questions...

The biggest unknown is whether international borders will reopen for tourists, without a requirement to self-quarantine for 14 days. Obviously, tourism becomes impossible if there remains a period of mandatory quarantine. The "travel and leisure" segment "hangs together", in the sense that to allow tourism into the country signifies reopening restaurants, bars, museums and hotels.
